main event: A round, pea-sized object with red and green lights was observed in the sky over Lovinger, Missouri on June 14, 1959.
interesting points: The observer initially thought the object was the evening star, but realized it was too late and low in the sky to be the star.
The object was observed moving west at an altitude of 2,200 to 2,500 feet, then changing course to 200 degrees, moving up and down.
The observation lasted for about 15 minutes.
The weather conditions at the time included clear skies, winds aloft, and visibility of 15 miles.
The color of the object was originally reported as white, going down to pink, green, and yellow, but was later changed to red and green, which could have been aircraft clearance lights.
sighted object: a round, pea-sized object with red and green lights
location: Lovinger, Missouri, 6 miles southwest of Kirksville AFB
